title: Electrophysiology metadata template template schema
description: Electrophysiology metadata template template schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.54

propertyDescriptions.Electrode Metadata: Electrodes describe the points of electrodes to the tissue used for recording electrophysiological signals.
propertyDescriptions.Channel Metadata: Channels are virtual sources of recorded signals. These might be of neuronal origin (e.g. online filtered LFP signals) or generated by the recording setup (e.g. synchronization signals, behavioral signals, etc).
propertyDescriptions.Acquisition System Metadata: nformation about the hardware and software of the data acquisition system.
propertyDescriptions.Probe Metadata: Probes are physical devices used for recording the electrophysiological data. They can be permanently implanted (chronic recordings) or inserted just for the recording (acute recordings).

items.title: Electrode Metadata field schema
items.description: Electrode Metadata field schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.54

propertyDescriptions.electrodeID: Unique identifier for the electrode, to match and be referenced in channel description.
propertyDescriptions.electrodeHemisphere: Brain hemisphere where the electrode was located.
propertyDescriptions.electrodeLocation: Textual indication of the location of the electrode (e.g. cortical layer 3, ca1, etc)
propertyDescriptions.electrodeX: Recorded position along the local x-axis relative to the probe origin and rotation.
propertyDescriptions.electrodeY: Recorded position along the local y-axis relative to the probe origin and rotation.
propertyDescriptions.electrodeZ: Recorded position along the local z-axis relative to the probe origin and rotation.
propertyDescriptions.electrodeImpedance: Impedance of the electrode or pipette (pipette_resistance). This can be a single value or a list of two values indicating a value range.
propertyDescriptions.electrodeShankID: Identifier to specify which shank of the probe the electrode is present. Alternatively, electrode probe identifier could be used here.
propertyDescriptions.electrodeShape: Description of the shape of the electrode, e.g. square, circle, etc.
propertyDescriptions.electrodeSize: Size of the electrode, e.g. non-insulated surface area or length of non-insulated cable.
propertyDescriptions.electrodeInsulationMaterial: Material used for insulation around the electrode.

items.title: Channel Metadata field schema
items.description: Channel Metadata field schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.54

propertyDescriptions.channelID: Identifier for the channel, to be referenced in the data files.
propertyDescriptions.channelType: Type of the channel, e.g. Neural signal, digital trial events, synchronization pulses, etc
propertyDescriptions.channelName: Human readable identifier for non-contact related signal, e.g. Daq internal synchronization signals, behavioral signals, behavioral cues, etc.
propertyDescriptions.channelUnit: Physical unit of the value represented in this channel.
propertyDescriptions.samplingFrequency: Sampling rate of the channel in hertz.
propertyDescriptions.streamID: Data stream of the recording the signal.
propertyDescriptions.channelDescription: Brief free-text description of the channel, or other information of interest.
propertyDescriptions.hardwareFilters: List of hardware filters (amplifiers) applied, details to be referenced from recording setup metadata for electrophysiology.
propertyDescriptions.softwareFilters: List of temporal software filters applied, details to be referenced from recording setup metadata for electrophysiology.
propertyDescriptions.notchFilters: List of notch filters applied, e.g. low_frequency, high_frequency, etc.
propertyDescriptions.channelDataQuality: Data quality observed on the channel.
propertyDescriptions.channelStatusDescription: Freeform text description of noise or artifact affecting data quality on the channel.
propertyDescriptions.channelGain: Amplification factor applied from signal detection at the contact to the signal stored in the data file.
propertyDescriptions.channelTimeReference: Reference channel used for time alignment of signals.
propertyDescriptions.channelTimeOffset: Time shift between signal of this channel to the reference channel.
propertyDescriptions.channelReference: Contact used as physical reference, e.g. contact identifier, physical location (subdural, chamber screw).
propertyDescriptions.channelGround: Information on the ground, e.g. Chamber screw, head post, ear clip, etc
propertyDescriptions.channelElectrodeID: Identifier for the electrode for a electrode based channel. Not applicable for non-contact related signal.

Acquisition System Metadata.title: Data acquisition system metadata element schema
Acquisition System Metadata.description: Data acquisition system metadata element schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.54

propertyDescriptions.powerLineFrequency: Frequency (in Hz) of the power line at the setup location.
propertyDescriptions.manufacturerModelName: Name of the data acquisition system used.
propertyDescriptions.manufacturerModelVersion: Version of the data acquisition system.
propertyDescriptions.recordingSetupCustomName: Custom name of the data acquis
propertyDescriptions.4d07fc98-7550-4d3b-b2b2-cdf09358a757: Custom name of the data acquisition system.
propertyDescriptions.institutionName: The name of the institution where data is recorded.
propertyDescriptions.institutionAddress: The address of the institution where data is recorded.
propertyDescriptions.samplingFrequency: Internal (maximum) sampling frequency of the AR recording.
propertyDescriptions.deviceSerialNumber: The serial number of the components of the setup, recommended to add serial numbers and versions of ALL components constituting the setup.
propertyDescriptions.usesSoftwareSuite: Software suite used for data acquisition.
propertyDescriptions.systemCreator: Name of the person(s) who set up the system.
propertyDescriptions.systemMaintainer: Name of the person(s) who maintains the system.

items.title: Probe Metadata field schema
items.description: Probe Metadata field schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.54

propertyDescriptions.probeHemisphere: Brain hemisphere where probe was located in.
propertyDescriptions.associatedBrainRegionID: Identifier of the associated brain region based on BIRNLEX ontology.
propertyDescriptions.associatedBrainRegion: Textual indication of the location of the probe in the brain.
propertyDescriptions.associatedBrainRegionQualityType: The method used to identify the associated brain region (estimated|proof) depending on anatomical pictures proofing the location or indirect estimation of the location.
propertyDescriptions.referenceAtlas: Reference atlas used for associated brain region
propertyDescriptions.hasReferenceSpace: The reference space used for the coordinate definition, could be, ‘anatomical’ , ‘recording chamber’, ‘sample’, ‘other’.
propertyDescriptions.anatomicalAxesOrientation: If anatomical reference space was used, then the corresponding anatomical axes orienatation. for instance, AIL would mean X, Y, Z axes are oriented towards anterior, inferior and left, respectively.
propertyDescriptions.probeRoll: Recorded rotation around the roll axis.
propertyDescriptions.probePitch: Recorded rotation around the pitch axis.
propertyDescriptions.probeYaw: Recorded rotation around the yaw axis.
propertyDescriptions.placementPicture: Relative or absolute path to photograph showing probe placement.
propertyDescriptions.probeManufacturer: Manufacturer of the probe system, eg., ‘opnephys’,’blackrock’, etc.
propertyDescriptions.probeDeviceSerialNumber: Manufacturer provided serial number of the probe.
propertyDescriptions.probeID: Unique identifier for each electrophysiological recording probe that is referenced in the dataset.
propertyDescriptions.probeType: Type of probe used – Utah array, laminar, single tetrode, etc.

probeHemisphere.schema:name: probeHemisphere
probeHemisphere.schema:description: Brain hemisphere where probe was located in.
